Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "computed property with getter and setter not handling camel to kebab case conversion" (#7511) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/pf30L2fg/1/](https://jsfiddle.net/pf30L2fg/1/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. HTML contains kebab-case for e.g. as per jsfiddle: v-model="age-days"
2. Computed property defined in new vue uses camelCase, and has a getter and setter (ageDays in the jsfiddle)

### What is expected?
page loads without error

### What is actually happening?
Chrome 63 & Firefox (dev) 58 both unable to render with:
Failed to generate render function:
ReferenceError: invalid assignment left-hand side in ...


---
Changing to an all lowercase name for the html v-model attribute and the computed  property - in the case of the jsfiddle changing both to agedays fixes the problem.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "fix translation error" (#2015) at vuejs/vue-router
Opened issue "Store.watch requires Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(...).get() to avoid error when accessing getter" (#1141) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/92559/](https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/92559/)

### Steps to reproduce
Attempt to use store.watch with a getter (sore.getters.GETTER_HERE) as explained in docs, and shown in reproduction.

### What is expected?
Handler to be called when variable updated.

### What is actually happening?
Uncaught Error: [vuex] store.watch only accepts a function.
